title.narrative: ECD/ECI:YOUNG CHILD WELL-BEING

description.narrative: Enhanced systems and capacities for equitable provision of quality Early Child Development (ECD) and ECI services, especially for the most vulnerable and excluded children, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Maternal And Newborn Health (Covid), Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of young boys and girls, including hard-to-reach children, Roma children and children with disabilities have access to quality health services including IECD

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced systems and capacities for equitable provision of quality ECD and ECI services, especially for the most vulnerable andexcluded children

description.narrative: A new multi-sectoral Early Childhood Development (ECD) Strategy for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina 2020-2025, previously developed with support of UNICEF, was adopted by the FBiH Government in November 2020. COVID-19 disrupted ECD services in most of the country due to the closures of kindergartens, schools and limited access to health centres and Centres for Social Welfare. Critical hygiene supplies were however made available for the safe re-opening of these services. Mental health centres received digital tools and support to organise the Second International Congress of Child and Adolescent Psychotherapy. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021
